head.title: Upper Scioto Valley School District Home

form.name: form1
form.h1: Upper Scioto Valley School District Home

span.div: In response to Governor Dewines directive to the coronavirus, USV will be closed starting at approximatelty 3:15 pm on March 13th through May 1, 2020 at 8 am. There will be no students allowed in the building during this time. As of now, students will return Monday, May 4th. Stay up to date on events and also get the latest news on the coronavirus by clicking the following link.

img.alt: Mary Rutan Hospital Orthopedics & Sports Medicine Proud Supporter & Exclusive athletic training service provider Rams Athletics

a.title: This event has a Hangouts Meet live stream. Watch: https://str Location: Starting at: 6:00 PM Ending at: 8:00 PM
This event has a video call. Join: https://meet.google.com/eiu Location: Starting at: 6:00 PM Ending at: 8:00 PM
Location: Starting at: ALL-DAY Ending at: ALL-DAY
Location: Starting at: ALL-DAY Ending at: ALL-DAY

span.div: The board meeting scheduled for Monday will be closed to the public due to social distancing guidelines. We will be straming it live, starting at 6pm on our facebook page and youtube. Any questions or concerns to share with the board can be emailed to Mr. Hurley (churley@usvschools.org) by noon on Monday. They will be read to the board at the board meeting.

h3.a: From the Desk of the Superintendent 4/14/20

p.span: You have once again made me proud to be a RAM. On our second round of work pick up yesterday, we had 97.3% of our students either have their work picked up or arrangements made for pick up. This is amazing and hopefully the last time we must do this activity.

h3.a: From the Desk of the Superintendent - 4/2/2020

span.span: With Governor DeWine’s announcement that the school building closure will continue through May 1, 2020, we will not be returning to school until Monday, May 4, 2020 at the earliest. With this announcement, some changes have been made to the education plan moving forward

h3.a: From the Desk of the Superintendent 3/20/20

p.span: I would like to start by thanking everyone that has helped the school or offered to help in any way during this time of need. If there are any questions or concerns, please contact us through email or call the school (419)757-3231.

If you call the school and do not enter an extension, you will be directed to the main office number. This phone will only be answered two days a week. However, messages will be checked and responded to daily on Monday through Friday.

div.span:
